   20: -module(epp_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: 
   24: -export([rec_1/1, include_local/1, predef_mac/1,
   25: 	 upcase_mac_1/1, upcase_mac_2/1,
   26: 	 variable_1/1, otp_4870/1, otp_4871/1, otp_5362/1,
   27:          pmod/1, not_circular/1, skip_header/1, otp_6277/1, gh_4995/1, otp_7702/1,
   28:          otp_8130/1, overload_mac/1, otp_8388/1, otp_8470/1,
   29:          otp_8562/1, otp_8665/1, otp_8911/1, otp_10302/1, otp_10820/1,
   30:          otp_11728/1, encoding/1, extends/1,  function_macro/1,
   31: 	 test_error/1, test_warning/1, otp_14285/1,
   32: 	 test_if/1,source_name/1,otp_16978/1,otp_16824/1,scan_file/1,file_macro/1,
   33:          string_concat_warning/1,
   34:          deterministic_include/1, nondeterministic_include/1,
   35:          gh_8268/1
   36:         ]).
   37: 
   38: -export([epp_parse_erl_form/2]).
   39: 
   40: %%
   41: %% Define to run outside of test server
   42: %%
   43: %%-define(STANDALONE,1).
   44: 
   45: -ifdef(STANDALONE).
   46: -compile(export_all).
   47: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   48: -define(config(A,B),config(A,B)).
   49: %% -define(t, test_server).
   50: -define(t, io).
   51: config(priv_dir, _) ->
   52:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_priv");
   53: config(data_dir, _) ->
   54:     filename:absname("./epp_SUITE_data").
   55: -else.
   56: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   57: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   58: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   59: 
   60: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   64:     ok.
   65: -endif.
   66: 
   67: suite() ->
   68:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   69:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   70: 
   71: all() ->
   72:     [rec_1, {group, upcase_mac}, include_local, predef_mac,
   73:      {group, variable}, otp_4870, otp_4871, otp_5362, pmod,
   74:      not_circular, skip_header, otp_6277, gh_4995, otp_7702, otp_8130,
   75:      overload_mac, otp_8388, otp_8470, otp_8562,
   76:      otp_8665, otp_8911, otp_10302, otp_10820, otp_11728,
   77:      encoding, extends, function_macro, test_error, test_warning,
   78:      otp_14285, test_if, source_name, otp_16978, otp_16824, scan_file, file_macro,
   79:      string_concat_warning,
   80:      deterministic_include, nondeterministic_include,
   81:      gh_8268].
   82: 
   83: groups() ->
   84:     [{upcase_mac, [], [upcase_mac_1, upcase_mac_2]},
   85:      {variable, [], [variable_1]}].
   86: 
   87: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   88:     Config.
   89: 
   90: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   91:     ok.
   92: 
   93: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   94:     Config.
   95: 
   96: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   97:     Config.
   98: 
   99: %% Recursive macros hang or crash epp (OTP-1398).
  100: rec_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  101:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac.erl"),
  102:     {ok, List} = epp_parse_file(File, [], []),
  103:     %% we should encounter errors
  104:     {value, _} = lists:keysearch(error, 1, List),
  105:     check_errors(List),
  106:     ok.
  107: 
  108: include_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  109:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  110:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "include_local.erl"),
  111:     FooHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","foo.hrl"]),
  112:     BarHrl = filename:join([DataDir,"include","bar.hrl"]),
  113:     %% include_local.erl includes include/foo.hrl which
  114:     %% includes bar.hrl (also in include/) without requiring
  115:     %% any additional include path, and overriding any file
  116:     %% of the same name that the path points to
  117:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [DataDir], []),
  118:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{true,true}}} =
  119: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  120:     [{File,1},{FooHrl,1},{BarHrl,1},{FooHrl,5},{File,5}] =
  121:         [ FileLine || {attribute,_,file,FileLine} <- List ],
  122:     ok.
  123: 
  124: file_macro(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  125:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  126:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "file_macro.erl"),
  127:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  128:                                        {source_name, "Other source"}]),
  129:     %% Both attribute a and b are defined as ?FILE, they should be the same
  130:     {attribute,_,a,FileA} = lists:keyfind(a, 3, List),
  131:     {attribute,_,b,FileB} = lists:keyfind(b, 3, List),
  132:     "Other source" = FileA = FileB,
  133:     ok.
  134: 
  135: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  137:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  138:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  139:                                        {deterministic, true},
  140:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  141: 
  142:     %% In deterministic mode, only basenames, rather than full paths, should
  143:     %% be written to the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  144:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  145:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"baz.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  146:                        (_) -> false
  147:                      end,
  148:                      List),
  149:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  150:             "including baz.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  151:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  152:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{"file.hrl",_Line}}) -> true;
  153:                        (_) -> false
  154:                      end,
  155:                      List),
  156:             "Expected a basename in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  157:             "including file.hrl in deterministic mode."),
  158:     ok.
  159: 
  160: nondeterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  161:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  162:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "deterministic_include.erl"),
  163:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, [DataDir]},
  164:                                        {source_name, "deterministic_include.erl"}]),
  165: 
  166:     %% Outside of deterministic mode, full paths, should be written to
  167:     %% the -file() attributes resulting from -include and -include_lib
  168:     %% to make debugging easier.
  169:     %% We don't try to assume what the full absolute path will be in the
  170:     %% unit test, since that can depend on the environment and how the
  171:     %% test is executed. Instead, we just look for whether there is
  172:     %% the parent directory along with the basename at least.
  173:     IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","baz.hrl"),
  174:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  175:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_Line}}) ->
  176:                          lists:suffix(IncludeAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  177:                        (_) -> false
  178:                      end,
  179:                      List),
  180:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  181:             "including baz.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  182:     IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix = filename:join("include","file.hrl"),
  183:     ?assert(lists:any(fun
  184:                        ({attribute,_Anno,file,{IncludePath,_line}}) ->
  185:                          lists:suffix(IncludeLibAbsolutePathSuffix,IncludePath);
  186:                        (_) -> false
  187:                      end,
  188:                      List),
  189:             "Expected an absolute in the -file attribute resulting from " ++
  190:             "including file.hrl outside of deterministic mode."),
  191:     ok.
  192: 
  193: %%% Here is a little reimplementation of epp:parse_file, which times out
  194: %%% after 4 seconds if the epp server doesn't respond. If we use the
  195: %%% regular epp:parse_file, the test case will time out, and then epp
  196: %%% server will go on growing until we dump core.
  197: epp_parse_file(File, Inc, Predef) ->
  198:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  199: 				     epp:open(File, Inc, Predef)
  200: 			     end),
  201:     List = do_epp_parse_file(fun() ->
  202: 				     Opts = [{name, File},
  203: 					     {includes, Inc},
  204: 					     {macros, Predef}],
  205: 				     epp:open(Opts)
  206: 			     end),
  207:     {ok, List}.
  208: 
  209: do_epp_parse_file(Open) ->
  210:     {ok, Epp} = Open(),
  211:     List = collect_epp_forms(Epp),
  212:     epp:close(Epp),
  213:     List.
  214: 
  215: collect_epp_forms(Epp) ->
  216:     Result = epp_parse_erl_form(Epp),
  217:     case Result of
  218: 	{error, _Error} ->
  219: 	    [Result | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  220: 	{ok, Form} ->
  221: 	    [Form | collect_epp_forms(Epp)];
  222: 	{eof, _} ->
  223: 	    [Result]
  224:     end.
  225: 
  226: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp) ->
  227:     P = spawn(?MODULE, epp_parse_erl_form, [Epp, self()]),
  228:     receive
  229: 	{P, Result} ->
  230: 	    Result
  231:     after 4000 ->
  232: 	    exit(Epp, kill),
  233: 	    exit(P, kill),
  234: 	    timeout
  235:     end.
  236: 
  237: epp_parse_erl_form(Epp, Parent) ->
  238:     Parent ! {self(), epp:parse_erl_form(Epp)}.
  239: 
  240: check_errors([]) ->
  241:     ok;
  242: check_errors([{error, Info} | Rest]) ->
  243:     {Line, Mod, Desc} = Info,
  244:     case Line of
  245: 	I when is_integer(I) -> ok;
  246: 	{L,C} when is_integer(L), is_integer(C), C >= 1 -> ok
  247:     end,
  248:     Str = lists:flatten(Mod:format_error(Desc)),
  249:     [Str] = io_lib:format("~s", [Str]),
  250:     check_errors(Rest);
  251: check_errors([_ | Rest]) ->
  252:     check_errors(Rest).
  253: 
  254: 
  255: upcase_mac_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  256:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  257:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  258:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  259:     Tuple = {1, 1, 3, 3},
  260:     ok.
  261: 
  262: upcase_mac_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac2.erl"),
  264:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], [{p, 5}, {'P', 6}]),
  265:     [_, {attribute, _, plupp, Tuple} | _] = List,
  266:     Tuple = {5, 5, 6, 6},
  267:     ok.
  268: 
  269: predef_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  270:     File = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "mac3.erl"),
  271:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  272:     [_,
  273:      {attribute, Anno, l, Line1},
  274:      {attribute, _, f, File},
  275:      {attribute, _, machine1, _},
  276:      {attribute, _, module, mac3},
  277:      {attribute, _, m, mac3},
  278:      {attribute, _, ms, "mac3"},
  279:      {attribute, _, machine2, _}
  280:      | _] = List,
  281:     Line1 = erl_anno:line(Anno),
  282:     ok.
  283: 
  284: variable_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  285:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  286:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "variable_1.erl"),
  287:     true = os:putenv("VAR", DataDir),
  288:     %% variable_1.erl includes variable_1_include.hrl and
  289:     %% variable_1_include_dir.hrl.
  290:     {ok, List} = epp:parse_file(File, [], []),
  291:     {value, {attribute,_,a,{value1,value2}}} =
  292: 	lists:keysearch(a,3,List),
  293:     ok.
  294: 
  295: %% undef without module declaration.
  296: otp_4870(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  297:     Ts = [{otp_4870,
  298:            <<"-undef(foo).
  299:            ">>,
  300:            []}],
  301:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  302:     ok.
  303: 
  304: %% crashing erl_scan
  305: otp_4871(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  306:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  307:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_4871.erl"),
  308:     ok = file:write_file(File, "-module(otp_4871)."),
  309:     %% Testing crash in erl_scan. Unfortunately there currently is
  310:     %% no known way to crash erl_scan so it is emulated by killing the
  311:     %% file io server. This assumes lots of things about how
  312:     %% the processes are started and how monitors are set up,
  313:     %% so there are some sanity checks before killing.
  314:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  315:     timer:sleep(1),
  316:     true = current_module(Epp, epp),
  317:     {monitored_by,[Io]} = process_info(Epp, monitored_by),
  318:     true = current_module(Io, file_io_server),
  319:     exit(Io, emulate_crash),
  320:     timer:sleep(1),
  321:     {error,{_Line,epp,cannot_parse}} = otp_4871_parse_file(Epp),
  322:     epp:close(Epp),
  323:     ok.
  324: 
  325: current_module(Pid, Mod) ->
  326:     {current_function, {Mod, _, _}} = process_info(Pid, current_function),
  327:     true.
  328: 
  329: otp_4871_parse_file(Epp) ->
  330:     case epp:parse_erl_form(Epp) of
  331: 	{ok,_} -> otp_4871_parse_file(Epp);
  332: 	Other -> Other
  333:     end.
  334: 
  335: %% OTP-5362. The -file attribute is recognized.
  336: otp_5362(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  338: 
  339:     Copts = [return, strong_validation,{i,Dir}],
  340: 
  341:     File_Incl = filename:join(Dir, "incl_5362.erl"),
  342:     File_Incl2 = filename:join(Dir, "incl2_5362.erl"),
  343:     File_Incl3 = filename:join(Dir, "incl3_5362.erl"),
  344:     Incl = <<"-module(incl_5362).
  345: 
  346:               -include(\"incl2_5362.erl\").
  347: 
  348:               -include_lib(\"incl3_5362.erl\").
  349: 
  350:               hi(There) -> % line 7
  351:                    a.
  352:            ">>,
  353:     Incl2 = <<"-file(\"some.file\", 100).
  354: 
  355:                foo(Bar) -> % line 102
  356:                    foo.
  357:             ">>,
  358:     Incl3 = <<"glurk(Foo) -> % line 1
  359:                   bar.
  360:             ">>,
  361:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl, Incl),
  362:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl2, Incl2),
  363:     ok = file:write_file(File_Incl3, Incl3),
  364: 
  365:     {ok, incl_5362, InclWarnings} = compile:file(File_Incl, Copts),
  366:     true = message_compare(
  367:                    [{File_Incl3,[{{1,1},erl_lint,{unused_function,{glurk,1}}},
  368:                                  {{1,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Foo'}}]},
  369:                     {File_Incl,[{{7,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{hi,1}}},
  370:                                 {{7,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'There'}}]},
  371:                     {"some.file",[{{102,16},erl_lint,{unused_function,{foo,1}}},
  372:                                   {{102,20},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Bar'}}]}],
  373:                    lists:usort(InclWarnings)),
  374: 
  375:     file:delete(File_Incl),
  376:     file:delete(File_Incl2),
  377:     file:delete(File_Incl3),
  378: 
  379:     %% A -file attribute referring back to the including file.
  380:     File_Back = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.erl"),
  381:     File_Back_hrl = filename:join(Dir, "back_5362.hrl"),
  382:     Back = <<"-module(back_5362).
  383: 
  384:               -export([foo/1]).
  385: 
  386:               -file(?FILE, 1).
  387:               -include(\"back_5362.hrl\").
  388: 
  389:               foo(V) -> % line 4
  390:                   bar.
  391:               ">>,
  392:     Back_hrl = [<<"
  393:                   -file(\"">>,File_Back,<<"\", 2).
  394:                  ">>],
  395: 
  396:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back, Back),
  397:     ok = file:write_file(File_Back_hrl, list_to_binary(Back_hrl)),
  398: 
  399:     {ok, back_5362, BackWarnings} = compile:file(File_Back, Copts),
  400:     true = message_compare(
  401:                    [{File_Back,[{{4,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'V'}}]}],
  402:                    BackWarnings),
  403:     file:delete(File_Back),
  404:     file:delete(File_Back_hrl),
  405: 
  406:     %% Set filename but keep line.
  407:     File_Change = filename:join(Dir, "change_5362.erl"),
  408:     Change = [<<"-module(change_5362).
  409: 
  410:                 -file(?FILE, 100).
  411: 
  412:                 -export([foo/1,bar/1]).
  413: 
  414:                 -file(\"other.file\", ?LINE). % like an included file...
  415:                 foo(A) -> % line 105
  416:                     bar.
  417: 
  418:                 -file(\"">>,File_Change,<<"\", 1000).
  419: 
  420:                 bar(B) -> % line 1002
  421:                     foo.
  422:               ">>],
  423: 
  424:     ok = file:write_file(File_Change, list_to_binary(Change)),
  425: 
  426:     {ok, change_5362, ChangeWarnings} =
  427:         compile:file(File_Change, Copts),
  428:     true = message_compare(
  429:                    [{File_Change,[{{1002,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]},
  430:                     {"other.file",[{{105,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}],
  431:                    lists:usort(ChangeWarnings)),
  432: 
  433:     file:delete(File_Change),
  434: 
  435:     %% -file attribute ending with a blank (not a newline).
  436:     File_Blank = filename:join(Dir, "blank_5362.erl"),
  437: 
  438:     Blank = <<"-module(blank_5362).
  439: 
  440:                -export([q/1,a/1,b/1,c/1]).
  441: 
  442:                -
  443:                file(?FILE, 18). q(Q) -> foo. % line 18
  444: 
  445:                a(A) -> % line 20
  446:                    1.
  447: 
  448:                -file(?FILE, 42).
  449: 
  450:                b(B) -> % line 44
  451:                    2.
  452: 
  453:                -file(?FILE, ?LINE). c(C) -> % line 47
  454:                    3.
  455:             ">>,
  456:     ok = file:write_file(File_Blank, Blank),
  457:     {ok, blank_5362, BlankWarnings} = compile:file(File_Blank, Copts),
  458:     true = message_compare(
  459:              [{File_Blank,[{{18,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}},
  460:                            {{20,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}},
  461:                            {{44,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  462:                            {{47,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C'}}]}],
  463:               lists:usort(BlankWarnings)),
  464:     file:delete(File_Blank),
  465: 
  466:     %% __FILE__ is set by inclusion and by -file attribute
  467:     FILE_incl = filename:join(Dir, "file_5362.erl"),
  468:     FILE_incl1 = filename:join(Dir, "file_incl_5362.erl"),
  469:     FILE = <<"-module(file_5362).
  470: 
  471:               -export([ff/0, ii/0]).
  472: 
  473:               -include(\"file_incl_5362.erl\").
  474: 
  475:               -file(\"other_file\", 100).
  476: 
  477:               ff() ->
  478:                   ?FILE.">>,
  479:     FILE1 = <<"ii() -> ?FILE.
  480:               ">>,
  481:     FILE_Mod = file_5362,
  482:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl, FILE),
  483:     ok = file:write_file(FILE_incl1, FILE1),
  484:     FILE_Copts = [return, {i,Dir},{outdir,Dir}],
  485:     {ok, file_5362, []} = compile:file(FILE_incl, FILE_Copts),
  486:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(FILE_incl, ".erl"),
  487:     {module, FILE_Mod} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, FILE_Mod),
  488:     II = FILE_Mod:ii(),
  489:     "file_incl_5362.erl" = filename:basename(II),
  490:     FF = FILE_Mod:ff(),
  491:     "other_file" = filename:basename(FF),
  492:     code:purge(file_5362),
  493: 
  494:     file:delete(FILE_incl),
  495:     file:delete(FILE_incl1),
  496: 
  497:     ok.
  498: 
  499: pmod(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  500:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  501:     Pmod = filename:join(DataDir, "pmod.erl"),
  502:     case epp:parse_file([Pmod], [], []) of
  503: 	      {ok,Forms} ->
  504: 		  %% io:format("~p\n", [Forms]),
  505: 		  [] = [F || {error,_}=F <- Forms],
  506: 		  ok
  507: 	  end,
  508:     ok.
  509: 
  510: not_circular(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  511:     %% Used to generate a compilation error, wrongly saying that it
  512:     %% was a circular definition.
  513: 
  514:     Ts = [{circular_1,
  515:            <<"-define(S(S), ??S).\n"
  516:              "t() -> \"string\" = ?S(string), ok.\n">>,
  517:            ok}],
  518:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  519:     ok.
  520: 
  521: %% Skip some bytes in the beginning of the file.
  522: skip_header(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  523:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  524:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "epp_test_skip_header.erl"]),
  525:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  526: 			       <<"some bytes
  527:                                   in the beginning of the file
  528:                                   that should be skipped
  529:                                   -module(epp_test_skip_header).
  530:                                   -export([main/1]).
  531: 
  532:                                   main(_) -> ?MODULE.
  533: 
  534:                                   ">>),
  535:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
  536:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  537:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  538:     io:get_line(Fd, ''),
  539:     {ok, Epp} = epp:open([{fd, Fd}, {name, list_to_atom(File)}, {location, 4}]),
  540: 
  541:     Forms = epp:parse_file(Epp),
  542:     [] = [Reason || {error, Reason} <- Forms],
  543:     ok = epp:close(Epp),
  544:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  545: 
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: %% ?MODULE before module declaration.
  549: otp_6277(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  550:     Ts = [{otp_6277,
  551:            <<"-undef(ASSERT).
  552:               -define(ASSERT, ?MODULE).
  553: 
  554:               ?ASSERT().">>,
  555:            [{error,{4,epp,{undefined,'MODULE', none}}}]}],
  556:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  557:     ok.
  558: 
  559: %% Test -ifdef(MODULE) before module declaration. Should not be
  560: %% considered defined.
  561: gh_4995(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     Ts = [{gh_4995,
  563:            <<"-ifdef(MODULE).
  564:               -record(r, {x = ?MODULE}).
  565:               -endif.">>,
  566:            []}],
  567:     [] = check(Config, Ts),
  568:     ok.
  569:

  571: otp_7702(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  573:     File = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.erl"),
  574:     Contents = <<"-module(file_7702).
  575: 
  576:                   -export([t/0]).
  577: 
  578:                   -define(RECEIVE(Msg,Body),
  579:                        receive
  580:                            Msg -> Body;
  581:                            M ->
  582:                 exit({unexpected_message,M,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  583:                        after 10000 ->
  584:                             exit({timeout,on_line,?LINE,was_expecting,??Msg})
  585:                        end).
  586:                    t() ->
  587:                        ?RECEIVE(foo, bar).">>,
  588:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents),
  589:     {ok, file_7702, []} =
  590:         compile:file(File, [debug_info,return,{outdir,Dir}]),

  592:     BeamFile = filename:join(Dir, "file_7702.beam"),
  593:     {ok, AC} = beam_lib:chunks(BeamFile, [abstract_code]),
  594: 
  595:     {file_7702,[{abstract_code,{_,Forms}}]} = AC,
  596:     Forms2 = unopaque_forms(Forms),
  597:         [{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
  598:          _,
  599:          _,
  600:          {function,_,t,0,

  603:               [_,

  606:                 [],
  607:                 [{_,_,_,
  608:                   [{tuple,{14,38},
  609:                     [{atom,{14,38},unexpected_message},

  878:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8130.erl"),
  879:     ok = file:write_file(File,
  880:                                "-module(otp_8130).\n"
  881:                                "-define(a, 3.14).\n"
  882:                                "t() -> ?a.\n"),
  883:     {ok,Epp} = epp:open(File, []),
  884:     PreDefMacs = macs(Epp),
  885:     ['BASE_MODULE','BASE_MODULE_STRING','BEAM',
  886:      'FEATURE_AVAILABLE', 'FEATURE_ENABLED','FILE',
  887:      'FUNCTION_ARITY','FUNCTION_NAME',
  888:      'LINE','MACHINE','MODULE','MODULE_STRING',
  889:      'OTP_RELEASE'] = PreDefMacs,
  890:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,file}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  891:     {ok,[{'-',_},{atom,_,module}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  892:     {ok,[{atom,_,t}|_]} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  893:     {eof,_} = epp:scan_erl_form(Epp),
  894:     [a] = macs(Epp) -- PreDefMacs,
  895:     epp:close(Epp),
  896: 
  897:     %% escript
  898:     ModuleStr = "any_name",
  899:     Module = list_to_atom(ModuleStr),
  900:     fun() ->
  901:             PreDefMacros = [{'MODULE', Module, redefine},
  902:                             {'MODULE_STRING', ModuleStr, redefine},
  903:                             a, {b,2}],
  904:             {ok,Epp2} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros),
  905:             [{atom,_,true}] = macro(Epp2, a),
  906:             [{integer,_,2}] = macro(Epp2, b),
  907:             false = macro(Epp2, c),
  908:             epp:close(Epp2)
  909:     end(),
  910:     fun() ->
  911:             PreDefMacros = [{a,b,c}],
  912:             {error,{bad,{a,b,c}}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  913:     end(),
  914:     fun() ->
  915:             PreDefMacros = [a, {a,1}],
  916:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  917:     end(),
  918:     fun() ->
  919:             PreDefMacros = [{a,1},a],
  920:             {error,{redefine,a}} = epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
  921:     end(),
  922: 
  923:     {error,enoent} = epp:open("no such file", []),
  924:     {error,enoent} = epp:parse_file("no such file", [], []),
  925: 
  926:     _ = ifdef(Config),
  927: 
  928:     ok.
  929: 
  930: scan_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  931:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  932:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
  933: 
  934:     {ok, Toks, [{encoding, _}]} = epp:scan_file(File, []),
  935:     [FileForm1, ModuleForm, ExportForm,
  936:      FileForm2, FileForm3, FunctionForm,
  937:      {eof,_}] = Toks,
  938:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm1,
  939:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,module}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ModuleForm,
  940:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,export}, {'(',_} | _ ] = ExportForm,
  941:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm2,
  942:     [{'-',_}, {atom,_,file}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FileForm3,
  943:     [{atom,_,ok}, {'(',_} | _ ] = FunctionForm,
  944:     ok.
  945: 
  946: macs(Epp) ->
  947:     Macros = epp:macro_defs(Epp), % not documented
  948:     lists:sort([MName || {{atom,MName},_} <- Macros]).
  949: 
  950: macro(Epp, N) ->
  951:     case lists:keyfind({atom,N}, 1, epp:macro_defs(Epp)) of
  952:         false -> false;
  953:         {{atom,N},{_,V}} -> V;
  954:         {{atom,N},Defs} -> lists:append([V || {_,{_,V}} <- Defs])
  955:     end.
  956: 
  957: ifdef(Config) ->
  958:     Cs = [{ifdef_c1,
  959:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  960:              "a bug.\n"
  961:              "-else.\n"
  962:              "-ifdef(A).\n"
  963:              "a bug.\n"
  964:              "-endif.\n"
  965:              "-else.\n"
  966:              "t() -> ok.\n"
  967:              "-endif.">>,
  968:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
  969: 
  970:           {ifdef_c2,
  971:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  972:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  973:              "a bug.\n"
  974:              "-endif.">>,
  975:            {errors,[{{3,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","bug"]}],[]}},
  976: 
  977:           {ifdef_c3,
  978:            <<"-define(a, true).\n"
  979:              "-ifdef(a).\n"
  980:              "-endif">>,
  981: 
  982:            {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
  983:                     {{3,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],
  984:           []}},
  985: 
  986:           {ifdef_c4,
  987:            <<"\n-ifdef a.\n"
  988:              "-endif.\n">>,
  989:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,ifdef}}],[]}},
  990: 
  991:           {ifdef_c5,
  992:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
  993:              "-else.\n"
  994:              "-endif.\n"
  995:              "-endif.\n">>,
  996:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",endif}}],[]}},
  997: 
  998:           {ifdef_c6,
  999:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1000:              "-else.\n"
 1001:              "-endif.\n"
 1002:              "-else.\n">>,
 1003:            {errors,[{{4,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'else'}}],[]}},
 1004: 
 1005:           {ifdef_c7,
 1006:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1007:              "-else\n"
 1008:              "foo bar\n"
 1009:              "-else.\n"
 1010:              "t() -> a.\n"
 1011:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1012:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,{bad,'else'}}],[]}},
 1013: 
 1014:           {ifdef_c8,
 1015:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1016:               "-foo bar.">>,
 1017:            {errors,[{{2,10},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifdef}}],[]}},
 1018: 
 1019:           {ifdef_c9,
 1020:            <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1021:               "3.3e12000.\n"
 1022:               "-endif.\n">>,
 1023:            []},
 1024: 
 1025:           {ifdef_c10,
 1026:            <<"\nt() -> 3.3e12000.\n">>,
 1027:            {errors,[{{2,8},erl_scan,{illegal,float}},
 1028:                     {{2,17},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}], % ...
 1029:             []}},
 1030: 
 1031:           {ifndef_c1,
 1032:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1033:              "-ifndef(A).\n"
 1034:              "t() -> ok.\n"
 1035:              "-endif.\n"
 1036:              "-else.\n"
 1037:              "a bug.\n"
 1038:              "-else.\n"
 1039:              "a bug.\n"
 1040:              "-endif.">>,
 1041:            {errors,[{{7,2},epp,{illegal,"repeated",'else'}}],[]}},
 1042: 
 1043:           {ifndef_c3,
 1044:            <<"-ifndef(a).\n"
 1045:              "-endif">>,
 1046: 
 1047:            {errors,[{{2,2},epp,{bad,endif}},
 1048:                     {{2,7},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",ifndef}}],
 1049:           []}},
 1050: 
 1051:           {ifndef_c4,
 1052:            <<"\n-ifndef a.\n"
 1053:              "-endif.\n">>,
 1054:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{bad,ifndef}}],[]}},
 1055: 
 1056:           {define_c5,
 1057:            <<"-\ndefine a.\n">>,
 1058:            {errors,[{{2,8},epp,{bad,define}}],[]}}
 1059:           ],
 1060:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1061: 
 1062:     Ts =  [{ifdef_1,
 1063:             <<"-ifdef(a).\n"
 1064:               "a bug.\n"
 1065:               "-else.\n"
 1066:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1067:               "a bug.\n"
 1068:               "-endif.\n"
 1069:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1070:               "-endif.">>,
 1071:            ok},

 1077:               "-ifdef(A).\n"
 1078:               "t() -> ok.\n"
 1079:               "-else.\n"
 1080:               "a bug.\n"
 1081:               "-endif.\n"
 1082:               "-else.\n"
 1083:               "a bug.\n"
 1084:               "-endif.">>,
 1085:            ok},

 1092:               "-define(A, true).\n"

 1155: 	     "-else.\n"

 1158: 	     "-else.\n"
 1159: 	     "-error(\"Neither CONFIG_A nor CONFIG_B are available\").\n"
 1160: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1161: 	     "-endif.\n">>,

 1203: %% OTP-12847: Test the -if and -elif directives and the built-in
 1204: %% function defined(Symbol).
 1205: test_if(Config) ->
 1206:     Cs = [{if_1c,
 1207: 	   <<"-if.\n"
 1208: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1209: 	     "-if no_parentheses.\n"
 1210: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1211: 	     "-if(syntax error.\n"
 1212: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1213: 	     "-if(true).\n"
 1214: 	     "-if(a+3).\n"
 1215: 	     "syntax error not triggered here.\n"
 1216: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1217:            {errors,[{{1,23},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1218: 		    {{3,5},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1219: 		    {{5,12},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","error"]},
 1220: 		    {{11,1},epp,{illegal,"unterminated",'if'}}],
 1221: 	    []}},
 1222: 
 1223: 	  {if_2c,			       	%Bad guard expressions.
 1224: 	   <<"-if(is_list(integer_to_list(42))).\n" %Not guard BIF.
 1225: 	     "-endif.\n"
 1226: 	     "-if(begin true end).\n"
 1227: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1228: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}},
 1229: 		    {{3,2},epp,{bad,'if'}}],
 1230: 	    []}},
 1231: 
 1232: 	  {if_3c,			       	%Invalid use of defined/1.
 1233: 	   <<"-if defined(42).\n"
 1234: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1235: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1236: 
 1237: 	  {if_4c,
 1238: 	   <<"-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n">>,
 1239: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},

 1242: 	   <<"-ifdef(not_defined_today).\n"
 1243: 	     "-else.\n"
 1244: 	     "-elif OTP_RELEASE > 18.\n"
 1245: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1246: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,{illegal,"unbalanced",'elif'}}],[]}},
 1247:

 1249: 	   <<"-if(defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1250: 	     "-else.\n"
 1251: 	     "-elif(true).\n"
 1252: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1253: 	   {errors,[{{3,2},epp,elif_after_else}],[]}},
 1254:

 1256: 	   <<"-if(begin true end).\n"		%Not a guard expression.
 1257: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1258: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{bad,'if'}}],[]}},
 1259:

 1261: 	   <<"-if(?foo).\n"                     %Undefined symbol.
 1262: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1263: 	   {errors,[{{1,25},epp,{undefined,foo,none}}],[]}}
 1264: 
 1265: 	 ],
 1266:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1267: 
 1268:     Ts = [{if_1,
 1269: 	   <<"-if(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1270: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1271: 	     "-else.\n"
 1272: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1273: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1274:            ok},
 1275:

 1277: 	   <<"-if(false).\n"
 1278: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1279: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1280: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1281: 	     "-else.\n"
 1282: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1283: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1284:            ok},
 1285: 
 1286: 	  {if_3,
 1287: 	   <<"-if(true).\n"
 1288: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1289: 	     "-elif(?OTP_RELEASE > 18).\n"
 1290: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1291: 	     "-else.\n"
 1292: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1293: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1294:            ok},
 1295: 
 1296: 	  {if_4,
 1297: 	   <<"-define(a, 1).\n"
 1298: 	     "-if(defined(a) andalso defined(OTP_RELEASE)).\n"
 1299: 	     "t() -> ok.\n"
 1300: 	     "-else.\n"
 1301: 	     "a bug.\n"
 1302: 	     "-endif.\n">>,
 1303:            ok},

 1349: %% Advanced test on overloading macros.
 1350: overload_mac(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1351:     Cs = [
 1352:           %% '-undef' removes all definitions of a macro
 1353:           {overload_mac_c1,
 1354:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1355:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1356:             "-undef(A).\n"
 1357:             "t1() -> ?A.\n",
 1358:             "t2() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1359:            {errors,[{{4,10},epp,{undefined,'A', none}},
 1360:                     {{5,10},epp,{undefined,'A', 1}}],[]}},
 1361: 
 1362:           %% cannot overload predefined macros
 1363:           {overload_mac_c2,
 1364:            <<"\n-define(MODULE(X), X).">>,
 1365:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'MODULE'}}],[]}},
 1366: 
 1367:           %% cannot overload macros with same arity
 1368:           {overload_mac_c3,
 1369:            <<"-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1370:             "-define(A(Y), Y).">>,
 1371:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine,'A'}}],[]}},
 1372: 
 1373:           {overload_mac_c4,
 1374:            <<"-define(A, a).\n"
 1375:             "-define(A(X,Y), {X,Y}).\n"
 1376:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1377:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1378:            {errors,[{{4,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}}
 1379:          ],
 1380:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1381: 
 1382:     Ts = [
 1383:           {overload_mac_r1,
 1384:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1385:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1386:             "-define(A(X, Y), {X, Y}).\n"
 1387:             "t() -> {?A, ?A(2), ?A(3, 4)}.">>,
 1388:            {1, 2, {3, 4}}},
 1389: 
 1390:           {overload_mac_r2,
 1391:            <<"-define(A, 1).\n"
 1392:             "-define(A(X), X).\n"
 1393:             "t() -> ?A(?A).">>,
 1394:            1},
 1395: 
 1396:           {overload_mac_r3,
 1397:            <<"-define(A, ?B).\n"
 1398:             "-define(B, a).\n"
 1399:             "-define(B(X), {b,X}).\n"
 1400:             "a(X) -> X.\n"
 1401:             "t() -> ?A(1).">>,
 1402:            1}
 1403:           ],
 1404:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 1405: 
 1406: 
 1407: %% OTP-8388. More tests on overloaded macros.
 1408: otp_8388(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1409:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1410:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_8388.erl"),
 1411:     ok = file:write_file(File, <<"-module(otp_8388)."
 1412:                                        "-define(LINE, a).">>),
 1413:     fun() ->
 1414:             PreDefMacros = [{'LINE', a}],
 1415:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1416:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1417:     end(),
 1418: 
 1419:     fun() ->
 1420:             PreDefMacros = ['LINE'],
 1421:             {error,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}} =
 1422:                 epp:open(File, [], PreDefMacros)
 1423:     end(),
 1424: 
 1425:     Ts = [
 1426:           {macro_1,
 1427:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1428:              "t() -> ?m(,).\n">>,
 1429:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1430:           {macro_2,
 1431:            <<"-define(m(A), A).\n"
 1432:              "t() -> ?m(a,).\n">>,
 1433:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{arg_error,m}}],[]}},
 1434:           {macro_3,
 1435:            <<"\n-define(LINE, a).\n">>,
 1436:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'LINE'}}],[]}},
 1437:           {macro_4,
 1438:            <<"-define(A(B, C, D), {B,C,D}).\n"
 1439:              "t() -> ?A(a,,3).\n">>,
 1440:            {errors,[{{2,9},epp,{mismatch,'A'}}],[]}},
 1441:           {macro_5,
 1442:            <<"-define(Q, {?F0(), ?F1(,,4)}).\n">>,
 1443:            {errors,[{{1,40},epp,{arg_error,'F1'}}],[]}},
 1444:           {macro_6,
 1445:            <<"-define(FOO(X), ?BAR(X)).\n"
 1446:              "-define(BAR(X), ?FOO(X)).\n"
 1447:              "-undef(FOO).\n"
 1448:              "test() -> ?BAR(1).\n">>,
 1449:            {errors,[{{4,12},epp,{undefined,'FOO',1}}],[]}}
 1450:          ],
 1451:     [] = compile(Config, Ts),
 1452:     ok.

 1477: %% OTP-8911. -file and file inclusion bug.
 1478: otp_8911(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1479:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1480: 	true ->
 1481: 	    {skip, "Testing cover, so cannot run when cover is already running"};
 1482: 	false ->
 1483: 	    do_otp_8911(Config)
 1484:     end.
 1485: do_otp_8911(Config) ->
 1486:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1487:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1488: 
 1489:     File = "i.erl",
 1490:     Cont = <<"-module(i).
 1491:               -export([t/0]).
 1492:               -file(\"fil1\", 100).
 1493:               -include(\"i1.erl\").
 1494:               t() ->
 1495:                   a.
 1496:            ">>,
 1497:     ok = file:write_file(File, Cont),
 1498:     Incl = <<"-file(\"fil2\", 35).
 1499:               t1() ->
 1500:                   b.
 1501:            ">>,
 1502:     File1 = "i1.erl",
 1503:     ok = file:write_file(File1, Incl),
 1504: 
 1505:     {ok, i} = cover:compile(File),
 1506:     a = i:t(),
 1507:     {ok,[{{i,6},1}]} = cover:analyse(i, calls, line),
 1508:     cover:stop(),
 1509: 
 1510:     file:delete(File),
 1511:     file:delete(File1),
 1512:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1513:     ok.
 1514:

 1522:     ok.
 1523: 
 1524: %% OTP-10302. Unicode characters scanner/parser.
 1525: otp_10302(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1526:     %% Two messages (one too many). Keeps otp_4871 happy.
 1527:     Cs = [{otp_10302,
 1528:            <<"%% coding: utf-8\n \n \x{E4}">>,
 1529:            {errors,[{{3,1},epp,cannot_parse},
 1530:                     {{3,1},file_io_server,invalid_unicode}],[]}}
 1531:          ],
 1532:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1533:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1534:     File = filename:join(Dir, "otp_10302.erl"),
 1535:     utf8 = encoding("coding: utf-8", File),
 1536:     utf8 = encoding("coding: UTF-8", File),
 1537:     latin1 = encoding("coding: Latin-1", File),
 1538:     latin1 = encoding("coding: latin-1", File),
 1539:     none = encoding_com("coding: utf-8", File),
 1540:     none = encoding_com("\n\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1541:     none = encoding_nocom("\n\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1542:     utf8 = encoding_com("\n%% coding: utf-8", File),
 1543:     utf8 = encoding_nocom("\n coding: utf-8", File),
 1544:     none = encoding("coding: \nutf-8", File),
 1545:     latin1 = encoding("Encoding :  latin-1", File),
 1546:     utf8 = encoding("ccoding: UTF-8", File),
 1547:     utf8 = encoding("coding= utf-8", File),
 1548:     utf8 = encoding_com(" %% coding= utf-8", File),
 1549:     utf8 = encoding("coding  =  utf-8", File),
 1550:     none = encoding("coding: utf-16 coding: utf-8", File), %first is bad
 1551:     none = encoding("Coding: utf-8", File),    %capital c
 1552:     utf8 = encoding("-*- coding: utf-8 -*-", File),
 1553:     utf8 = encoding("-*-coding= utf-8-*-", File),
 1554:     utf8 = encoding("codingcoding= utf-8", File),
 1555:     ok = prefix("coding: utf-8", File, utf8),
 1556: 
 1557:     "coding: latin-1" = epp:encoding_to_string(latin1),
 1558:     "coding: utf-8" = epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),
 1559:     true = lists:member(epp:default_encoding(), [latin1, utf8]),
 1560: 
 1561:     ok.
 1562: 
 1563: prefix(S, File, Enc) ->
 1564:     prefix(0, S, File, Enc).
 1565: 
 1566: prefix(100, _S, _File, _) ->
 1567:     ok;
 1568: prefix(N, S, File, Enc) ->
 1569:     Enc = encoding(lists:duplicate(N, $\s) ++ S, File),
 1570:     prefix(N+1, S, File, Enc).
 1571: 
 1572: encoding(Enc, File) ->
 1573:     E = encoding_com("%% " ++ Enc, File),
 1574:     none = encoding_com(Enc, File),
 1575:     E = encoding_nocom(Enc, File).
 1576: 
 1577: encoding_com(Enc, File) ->
 1578:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1579:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B),
 1580:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1581:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1582:     E = epp:set_encoding(Fd),
 1583:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1584:     E = epp:read_encoding(File).
 1585: 
 1586: encoding_nocom(Enc, File) ->
 1587:     Options = [{in_comment_only, false}],
 1588:     B = list_to_binary(Enc),
 1589:     E = epp:read_encoding_from_binary(B, Options),
 1590:     ok = file:write_file(File, Enc),
 1591:     {ok, Fd} = file:open(File, [read]),
 1592:     ok = file:close(Fd),
 1593:     E = epp:read_encoding(File, Options).
 1594: 
 1595: %% OTP-10820. Unicode filenames.
 1596: otp_10820(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1597:     L = [915,953,959,973,957,953,954,959,957,964],
 1598:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1599:     File = filename:join(Dir, L++".erl"),
 1600:     C1 = <<"%% coding: utf-8\n -module(any).">>,
 1601:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1602:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C1, ["+pc", "unicode"]),
 1603:     C2 = <<"\n-module(any).">>,
 1604:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "latin1"]),
 1605:     ok = do_otp_10820(File, C2, ["+pc", "unicode"]).
 1606: 
 1607: do_otp_10820(File, C, PC) ->
 1608:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+fnu"] ++ PC),
 1609:     ok = rpc:call(Node, file, write_file, [File, C]),
 1610:     {ok, Forms} = rpc:call(Node, epp, parse_file, [File, [],[]]),
 1611:     [{attribute,1,file,{File,1}},
 1612:      {attribute,2,module,any},
 1613:      {eof,2}] = unopaque_forms(Forms),
 1614:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1615:     ok.
 1616: 
 1617: %% OTP_14285: Unicode atoms.
 1618: otp_14285(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1619:     %% This is just a sample of errors.
 1620:     Cs = [{otp_14285,
 1621:            <<"-export([f/0]).
 1622:               -define('a\x{400}b', 'a\x{400}d').
 1623:               f() ->
 1624:                   ?'a\x{400}b'.
 1625:               g() ->
 1626:                   ?\"a\x{400}b\".
 1627:               h() ->
 1628:                   ?'a\x{400}no'().
 1629:               "/utf8>>,
 1630:            {errors,[{{6,20},epp,{call,[63,[91,["97",44,"1024",44,"98"],93]]}},
 1631:                     {{8,20},epp,{undefined,'a\x{400}no',0}}],
 1632:             []}}
 1633:          ],
 1634:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1635:     ok.
 1636: 
 1637: %% OTP-11728. Bugfix circular macro.
 1638: otp_11728(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1639:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1640:     H = <<"-define(MACRO,[[]++?MACRO]).">>,
 1641:     HrlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.hrl"),
 1642:     ok = file:write_file(HrlFile, H),
 1643:     C = <<"-module(otp_11728).
 1644:            -export([function_name/0]).
 1645: 
 1646:            -include(\"otp_11728.hrl\").
 1647: 
 1648:            function_name()->
 1649:                A=?MACRO, % line 7
 1650:                ok">>,
 1651:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "otp_11728.erl"),
 1652:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C),
 1653:     {ok, L} = epp:parse_file(ErlFile, [Dir], []),
 1654:     true = lists:member({error,{7,epp,{circular,'MACRO',none}}}, L),
 1655:     _ = file:delete(HrlFile),
 1656:     _ = file:delete(ErlFile),
 1657:     ok.
 1658: 
 1659: %% Check the new API for setting the default encoding.
 1660: encoding(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1661:     Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1662:     ErlFile = filename:join(Dir, "encoding.erl"),
 1663: 
 1664:     %% Try a latin-1 file with no encoding given.
 1665:     C1 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1666:            %% ",246,"
 1667: 	  ">>,
 1668:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C1),
 1669:     {ok,[{attribute,{1,1},file,_},
 1670: 	 {attribute,{1,2},module,encoding},
 1671: 	 {error,_},
 1672: 	 {error,{{2,12},epp,cannot_parse}},
 1673: 	 {eof,{2,12}}]} = epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{location, {1,1}}]),
 1674:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1675: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1676: 	 {eof,3}]} =
 1677: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1678:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1679: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1680: 	 {eof,3}],Extra0} =
 1681: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1682:     none = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra0),
 1683: 
 1684:     %% Try a latin-1 file with encoding given in a comment.
 1685:     C2 = <<"-module(encoding).
 1686:            %% encoding: latin-1
 1687:            %% ",246,"
 1688: 	  ">>,
 1689:     ok = file:write_file(ErlFile, C2),
 1690:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1691: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1692: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1693: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, []),
 1694:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1695: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1696: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1697: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1}]),
 1698:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1699: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1700: 	 {eof,4}]} =
 1701: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8}]),
 1702:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1703: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1704: 	 {eof,4}],Extra1} =
 1705: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [extra]),
 1706:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra1),
 1707: 
 1708:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1709: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1710: 	 {eof,4}],Extra2} =
 1711: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,latin1},extra]),
 1712:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra2),
 1713:     {ok,[{attribute,1,file,_},
 1714: 	 {attribute,1,module,encoding},
 1715: 	 {eof,4}],Extra3} =
 1716: 	epp_parse_file(ErlFile, [{default_encoding,utf8},extra]),
 1717:     latin1 = proplists:get_value(encoding, Extra3),
 1718:     ok.
 1719:

 1725:

 1727: 	   <<"-extends(some_other_module).\n"

 1729: 	   {some_other_module,"some_other_module"}}],
 1730:

 1732:     ok.

 1734: function_macro(Config) ->
 1735:     Cs = [{f_c1,
 1736: 	   <<"-define(FUNCTION_NAME, a).\n"
 1737: 	     "-define(FUNCTION_ARITY, a).\n"
 1738: 	     "-define(FS,\n"
 1739: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1740: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1741: 	     "-attr({f,?FUNCTION_NAME}).\n"
 1742: 	     "-attr2(?FS).\n"
 1743: 	     "-file(?FUNCTION_ARITY, 1).\n"
 1744: 	     "f1() ?FUNCTION_NAME/?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1745: 	     "f2(?FUNCTION_NAME.\n">>,
 1746: 	   {errors,[{{1,28},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1747: 		    {{2,9},epp,{redefine_predef,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1748: 		    {{6,11},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1749: 		    {{7,9},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1750: 		    {{8,8},epp,{illegal_function,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}},
 1751: 		    {{9,7},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","f1"]},
 1752: 		    {{10,18},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'.'"]}],
 1753: 	    []}},
 1754: 
 1755: 	  {f_c2,
 1756: 	   <<"a({a) -> ?FUNCTION_NAME.\n"
 1757: 	     "b(}{) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1758: 	     "c(?FUNCTION_NAME, ?not_defined) -> ok.\n">>,
 1759: 	   {errors,[{{1,24},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","')'"]},
 1760: 		    {{2,3},erl_parse,["syntax error before: ","'}'"]},
 1761: 		    {{3,20},epp,{undefined,not_defined,none}}],
 1762: 	    []}},
 1763: 
 1764: 	  {f_c3,
 1765: 	   <<"?FUNCTION_NAME() -> ok.\n"
 1766: 	     "?FUNCTION_ARITY() -> ok.\n">>,
 1767: 	   {errors,[{{1,21},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_NAME'}},
 1768: 		    {{2,2},epp,{illegal_function_usage,'FUNCTION_ARITY'}}],
 1769: 	    []}}
 1770: 	 ],
 1771: 
 1772:     [] = compile(Config, Cs),
 1773: 
 1774:     Ts = [{f_1,
 1775: 	   <<"t() -> {a,0} = a(), {b,1} = b(1), {c,2} = c(1, 2),\n"
 1776: 	     "  {d,1} = d({d,1}), {foo,1} = foo(foo), ok.\n"
 1777: 	     "a() -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1778: 	     "b(_) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1779: 	     "c(_, (_)) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n"
 1780: 	     "d({?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}=F) -> F.\n"
 1781: 	     "-define(FOO, foo).\n"
 1782: 	     "?FOO(?FOO) -> {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY}.\n">>,
 1783: 	   ok},
 1784: 
 1785: 	  {f_2,
 1786: 	   <<"t() ->\n"
 1787:              "  A = {a,[<<0:24>>,#{a=>1,b=>2}]},\n"
 1788: 	     "  1 = a(A),\n"
 1789: 	     "  ok.\n"
 1790: 	     "a({a,[<<_,_,_>>,#{a:=1,b:=2}]}) -> ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n">>,
 1791: 	   ok},
 1792: 
 1793: 	  {f_3,
 1794: 	   <<"-define(FS,\n"
 1795: 	     " atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ \"/\" ++\n"
 1796: 	     " integer_to_list(?FUNCTION_ARITY)).\n"
 1797: 	     "t() ->\n"
 1798: 	     "  {t,0} = {?FUNCTION_NAME,?FUNCTION_ARITY},\n"
 1799: 	     "  \"t/0\" = ?FS,\n"
 1800: 	     "  ok.\n">>,
 1801: 	   ok},
 1802: 
 1803: 	  {f_4,
 1804: 	   <<"-define(__, _, _).\n"
 1805: 	     "-define(FF, ?FUNCTION_NAME, ?FUNCTION_ARITY).\n"
 1806: 	     "a(?__) -> 2 = ?FUNCTION_ARITY.\n"
 1807: 	     "b(?FUNCTION_ARITY, ?__) -> ok.\n"
 1808: 	     "c(?FF) -> ok.\n"
 1809: 	     "t() -> a(1, 2), b(3, 1, 2), c(c, 2), ok.\n">>,
 1810: 	   ok}
 1811: 	 ],
 1812:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1813: 
 1814:     ok.
 1815: 
 1816: source_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1817:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1818:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "source_name.erl"),
 1819: 
 1820:     source_name_1(File, "/test/gurka.erl"),
 1821:     source_name_1(File, "gaffel.erl"),
 1822: 
 1823:     ok.
 1824: 
 1825: source_name_1(File, Expected) ->
 1826:     Res = epp:parse_file(File, [{source_name, Expected}]),
 1827:     {ok, [{attribute,_,file,{Expected,_}} | _Forms]} = Res.
 1828:

 1832:     Vs = [#{},
 1833:           #{k => 1,[[a],[{}]] => "str"},
 1834:           #{#{} => [{#{x=>#{3=>$3}}},{3.14,#{}}]}],
 1835:     Ts = [{erl_parse_tokens,
 1836:            P,
 1837:            [{d,{a,V}}],
 1838:            V} || V <- Vs],
 1839:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1840: 
 1841:     ok.

 2064: string_concat_warning(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2065:     Cs1 =
 2066:         [{string_concat_warning_1,
 2067:           <<"\n"
 2068:             "-export([foo/0]).\n"
 2069:             "foo() ->\n"
 2070:             "    \" \"\"\".\n">>,
 2071:           {warnings,
 2072:            [{{4,8},epp,string_concat}]}},
 2073:         {string_concat_warning_2,
 2074:           <<"\n"
 2075:             "-export([foo/0]).\n"
 2076:             "foo() ->\n"
 2077:             "    \" \"\"\" \" \"\"\".\n">>,
 2078:           {warnings,
 2079:            [{{4,8},epp,string_concat},
 2080:             {{4,14},epp,string_concat}]}}],
 2081:     [] = compile(Config, Cs1),
 2082: 
 2083:     Cs2 =
 2084:         [{string_concat_warning_3,
 2085:           <<"\n-doc \"foo\".\n">>,
 2086:           []},
 2087:          {string_concat_warning_4,
 2088:           <<"\n-doc \"\" \"foo\" \"\".\n">>,
 2089:           []},
 2090:          {string_concat_warning_5,
 2091:           <<"\n"
 2092:             "-doc \"\"\"\n"
 2093:             "    foo\n"
 2094:             "    \"\"\".\n">>,
 2095:           {warnings,
 2096:            [{{2,8},epp,string_concat},
 2097:             {{4,6},epp,string_concat}]}},
 2098:          {string_concat_warning_6,
 2099:           <<"\n"
 2100:             "-doc  \"\"\"\"\n"
 2101:             "      \"\"\"\".\n">>,
 2102:           {warnings,
 2103:            [{{2,9},epp,string_concat},
 2104:             {{3,9},epp,string_concat}]}},
 2105:          {string_concat_warning_7,
 2106:           <<"\n"
 2107:             "-doc   \"\"\"\"\"\n"
 2108:             "       foo\n"
 2109:             "       \"\"\"\"\".\n">>,
 2110:           {warnings,
 2111:            [{{2,10},epp,string_concat},
 2112:             {{2,12},epp,string_concat},
 2113:             {{4,9},epp,string_concat},
 2114:             {{4,11},epp,string_concat}]}}
 2115:         ],
 2116:     [] = compile(Config, Cs2),
 2117: 
 2118:     Cs3 =
 2119:         [{string_concat_warning_8,
 2120:           <<"\n"
 2121:             "-export([foo/0]).\n"
 2122:             "foo() ->\n"
 2123:             "    \"\"\"\n"
 2124:             "    bar\n"
 2125:             "    \"\"\".\n">>,
 2126:           {warnings,
 2127:            [{{4,7},epp,string_concat},
 2128:             {{6,6},epp,string_concat}]}},
 2129:          {string_concat_warning_9,
 2130:           <<"\n"
 2131:             "-export([foo/0]).\n"
 2132:             "foo() ->\n"
 2133:             "    \"\"\"\"\n"
 2134:             "    ++ lists:duplicate(4, $x) ++\n"
 2135:             "    \"\"\"\".\n">>,
 2136:           {warnings,
 2137:            [{{4,7},epp,string_concat},
 2138:             {{6,7},epp,string_concat}]}},
 2139:          {string_concat_warning_10,
 2140:           <<"\n"
 2141:             "-export([foo/0]).\n"
 2142:             "foo() ->\n"
 2143:             "    \"\"\"\"\"\n"
 2144:             "    bar\n"
 2145:             "    \"\"\"\"\".\n">>,
 2146:           {warnings,
 2147:            [{{4,7},epp,string_concat},
 2148:             {{4,9},epp,string_concat},
 2149:             {{6,6},epp,string_concat},
 2150:             {{6,8},epp,string_concat}]}} ],
 2151:     [] = compile(Config, Cs3),
 2152: 
 2153:     ok.
 2154: 
 2155: 
 2156: gh_8268(Config) ->
 2157:     Ts = [{circular_1,
 2158:            <<"-define(LOG(Tag, Code), io:format(\"~s\", [Tag]), Code).
 2159:              more_work() -> ok.
 2160:              some_work() -> ok.
 2161:              t() ->
 2162:                 ?LOG(work,
 2163:                      begin
 2164:                         maybe
 2165:                            ok ?= some_work()
 2166:                         end,
 2167:                         more_work()
 2168:                      end).
 2169:              ">>,
 2170:            [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}],
 2171:            ok}],
 2172:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2173:     ok.
 2174: 
 2175: 
 2176: %% Start location is 1.
 2177: check(Config, Tests) ->
 2178:     eval_tests(Config, fun check_test/3, Tests).
 2179: 
 2180: %% Start location is {1,1}.
 2181: compile(Config, Tests) ->
 2182:     eval_tests(Config, fun compile_test/3, Tests).
 2183: 
 2184: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2185:     eval_tests(Config, fun run_test/3, Tests).
 2186: 
 2187: eval_tests(Config, Fun, Tests) ->
 2188:     TestsWithOpts =
 2189:         [case Test of
 2190:              {N,P,E} ->
 2191:                  {N,P,[],E};
 2192:              {_,_,_,_} ->
 2193:                  Test
 2194:          end || Test <- Tests],
 2195:     F = fun({N,P,Opts,E}, BadL) ->
 2196:                 %% io:format("Testing ~p~n", [P]),
 2197:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, Opts),
 2198:                 %% The result should be the same when enabling maybe ... end
 2199:                 %% (making 'else' a keyword instead of an atom).
 2200:                 Return = Fun(Config, P, [{feature,maybe_expr,enable}|Opts]),
 2201:                 case message_compare(E, Return) of
 2202:                     true ->
 2203:                         case E of
 2204:                             {errors, Errors} ->
 2205:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2206:                             {warnings, Errors} ->
 2207:                                 call_format_error(Errors);
 2208:                             _ ->
 2209:                                 ok
 2210:                         end,
 2211:                         BadL;
 2212:                     false ->
 2213:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2214:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Return]),
 2215: 			fail()
 2216:                 end
 2217:         end,
 2218:     lists:foldl(F, [], TestsWithOpts).
 2219: 
 2220: check_test(Config, Test, Opts) ->
 2221:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2222:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2223:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2224:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2225:     case epp:parse_file(File, [{includes, PrivDir}| Opts]) of
 2226: 	{ok,Forms} ->
 2227: 	    Errors = [E || E={error,_} <- Forms],
 2228: 	    call_format_error([E || {error,E} <- Errors]),
 2229: 	    Errors;
 2230: 	{error,Error} ->
 2231: 	    Error
 2232:     end.
 2233: 
 2234: compile_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2235:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). ">>, Test0],
 2236:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2237:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2238:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2239:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2240:     Opts = [export_all,nowarn_export_all,return,nowarn_unused_record,{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2241:     case compile_file(File, Opts) of
 2242:         {ok, Ws} -> warnings(File, Ws);
 2243:         {errors, Errors}=Else ->
 2244:             call_format_error(Errors),
 2245:             Else;
 2246:         Else -> Else
 2247:     end.
 2248: 
 2249: warnings(File, Ws) ->
 2250:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 2251:         [] ->
 2252: 	    [];
 2253:         L ->
 2254: 	    call_format_error(L),
 2255: 	    {warnings, L}
 2256:     end.
 2257: 
 2258: compile_file(File, Opts) ->
 2259:     case compile:file(File, Opts) of
 2260:         {ok, _M, Ws} -> {ok, Ws};
 2261:         {error, FEs, []} -> {errors, errs(FEs, File), []};
 2262:         {error, FEs, [{File,Ws}]} -> {error, errs(FEs, File), Ws}
 2263:     end.
 2264: 
 2265: errs([{File,Es}|L], File) ->
 2266:     call_format_error(Es),
 2267:     Es ++ errs(L, File);
 2268: errs([_|L], File) ->
 2269:     errs(L, File);
 2270: errs([], _File) ->
 2271:     [].
 2272: 
 2273: %% Smoke test and coverage of format_error/1.
 2274: call_format_error([{_,M,E}|T]) ->
 2275:     _ = M:format_error(E),
 2276:     call_format_error(T);
 2277: call_format_error([]) ->
 2278:     ok.
 2279: 
 2280: epp_parse_file(File, Opts) ->
 2281:     case epp:parse_file(File, Opts) of
 2282:         {ok, Forms} ->
 2283:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms)};
 2284:         {ok, Forms, Other} ->
 2285:             {ok, unopaque_forms(Forms), Other}
 2286:     end.
 2287: 
 2288: unopaque_forms(Forms) ->
 2289:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 2290: 
 2291: run_test(Config, Test0, Opts0) ->
 2292:     Test = [<<"-module(epp_test). -export([t/0]). ">>, Test0],
 2293:     Filename = "epp_test.erl",
 2294:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2295:     File = filename:join(PrivDir, Filename),
 2296:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2297:     Opts = [return, {i,PrivDir},{outdir,PrivDir}] ++ Opts0,
 2298:     {ok, epp_test, []} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2299:     AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2300: 
 2301:     case lists:member({feature, maybe_expr, enable}, Opts0) of
 2302:         false ->
 2303:             %% Run in node
 2304:             {module, epp_test} = code:load_abs(AbsFile, epp_test),
 2305:             Reply = epp_test:t(),
 2306:             code:purge(epp_test),
 2307:             Reply;
 2308:         true ->
 2309:             %% Run in peer with maybe_expr enabled
 2310:             {ok, Peer, Node} =
 2311:                 ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-enable-feature","maybe_expr"],
 2312:                            connection => 0}),
 2313:             {module, epp_test} =
 2314:                 rpc:call(Node, code, load_abs, [AbsFile, epp_test]),
 2315:             Reply = rpc:call(Node, epp_test, t, []),
 2316:             peer:stop(Peer),
 2317:             Reply
 2318:     end.
 2319: 
 2320: fail() ->
 2321:     ct:fail(failed).
 2322: 
 2323: message_compare(T, T) ->
 2324:     T =:= T.
